column2: It's as if God has placed his hand on your shoulder, you feel ALIVE!
column3: C'est comme si Dieu a posé sa main sur votre épaule, vous sentir vivant!
column4: Es ist, als ob Gott hat seine Hand auf die Schulter gelegt, fühlen Sie sich lebendig!
column6: Es como si Dios ha puesto su mano sobre el hombro, te sientes vivo!

column2: Your duty is to your god(s), your vassals respect you for it.
column3: Votre devoir est de votre règle.

column2: A very popular priest, maybe even the next pope.
This person's dynasty is protected by some unknown force against diseases and injury

Start Pillaging this Holding.\n\nWhile Pillaging this Holding the revolt risk of the entire Province will be increased significantly, but in exchange you will receive the following every §Y6 months§! until the holding is completely destroyed:
column3: Commencer à piller cette propriété.\n\nPiller cette propriété augmente significativement le risque de révolte du comté, mais en échange vous recevrez tous les §Y6 mois§! jusqu'à la destruction complète de la propriété les choses suivantes :
column4: Beginnt mit der Plünderung dieser Liegenschaft.\n\nWährend diese Liegenschaft geplündert wird, steigt das Aufstandsrisiko in der gesamten Provinz enorm. Im Gegenzug erhaltet Ihr aber alle §Y6 Monate§! bis zur vollständigen Zerstörung der Liegenschaft Folgendes:
column6: Empezar a saquear este asentamiento.\n\nSaquear este asentamiento aumentará considerablemente el riesgo de rebelión de toda la provincia, pero a cambio recibirás lo siguiente cada §Y6 meses§! hasta que el asentamiento haya sido totalmente destruido:

column2: In return for a gift of gold the church will take defacto ownership of the land a monestary is hosted on.
This character claims descent from [This.GetFirstNameWithNick] who collapsed a great empire under his military might
The power and size of this Empire must be halted before it can grow exponentially.
War to Dismantle the threat of [Recipient.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]
Equipped with Slings, Javalins and Axes, this guard allows the general to better command Skirmishers by integrating into their structure.
Equipped with Heavy Armour and weapons, this guard allows the general to better command Heavy Infantry by integrating into their structure.
Equipped with Light Armour and Spears, this guard allows the general to better command Spear troops by integrating into their structure.
Equipped with Light Armour and fast Mounts, this guard allows the general to better command Light Cavalry by integrating into their structure.
Equipped with Heavy Armour and Large Mounts, this guard allows the general to better command Heavy Cavalry by integrating into their structure.
Equipped with Bows, Guns or Crossbows, this guard allows the general to better command Ranged troops by integrating into their structure.

The master of the audit is tasked with supervising all areas of government, and bringing any acts of corruption they detect to light. It is a position of great trust, since nobody audits the master of the audit...

I have been observing my ward [From.GetName] recently, and I have noticed that [From.GetSheHe] has been getting into the same kind of interests as me. Should I do something about this?
Your ward will pick up one of your lifestyles.
You will try to stop your ward from picking up one of your hobbies, though you are not guaranteed to succeed.
Recently I have gained interest in one of [Educator.GetTitledFirstName]'s hobbies. Though a small occupation at first, I feel like I could do this for the rest of my life.
The castle has never been this efficient before!
So the difference between a trebuchet and a catapult is...
My sword is an extension of my arm.
There's nothing better than to see your work bear fruits.
Nobody throws parties better than me!
It is not about efficiency, but the thrill of the hunt.
it is amazing how much the human body can endure...
Better to stab someone in the back than be the one stabbed.
The best kind of knowledge is the hidden one.
The pen is mighter than the sword.
I wonder what my friends are up to...
So Knights are good at flanking, but Spearmen are..
Roses are red, violets are blue...
I have gained a distaste for meat.
Fish fear me, no beast dare make a sound in my presence.
So that's how you get girls to like you!
So that's how you get boys to like you!
This is one seriously perturbed vassal.
This character is the very aspect of healthy living.
This character is a true war master!

§Y*§! This government is §MBureaucratic§! and thus can either §Gbenefit from an efficient bureaucracy§! if the ruler and councillors are talented and virtuous or §Rsuffer from a corrupt bureaucracy§! if the ruler and councillors are inept and sinful(if fitna fracture is enabled)

The Fetha Nägäst or "Law of Kings" is the Ethiopian legal code, written long before the Event and based largely on ancient Byzantine law, albeit with greater focus on ecclesiastical law and monastic towns. The Imperial family holds great influence over the Empire, the successor being elected by Councilors and Commanders from among the ruling dynasty.
Buffs all provinces within your realm.
Removes all Province and Holding buffs granted by this cheat.
Buffs all provinces within your realm, including vassals.
Removes all Province and Holding buffs granted by this cheat to AI Vassals.
Create a child of your dynasty.
Forces them to have children with their spouse, you must continue your dynasty!
Raises the target character to the status of nobility, granting them a dynasty
Adopts the character with spouses dynasty.  You must not let them fall!
Make [Root.GetBestName] independent. [Root.GetSheHe] will be a free [Root.GetTitle]!
§Y[Root.GetBestName]§! will be granted independence from [Root.GetHerHis] liege §Y[Root.Liege.GetBestName]§!

[Root.GetTitledFirstName] will be allowed to change laws again.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] will be allowed to declare special wars again.

Opens the Healer for your character
Opens the Trait Menu for your character
Some times you just need a quick buff!
Only meant to be used when you are low on one or the other. Use the currency menu if you just want more.

Toggles the Right+click menus for you and everyone else. Helps avoid cluttering
Creats a woman for marriage... or other things.
Choose to spawn a varied amount of troops at your Capital. These are 'special' troops, they shouldn't cost money.
Creates a fleet of 200 vessals in the closest owned sea worthy province to your capital.

Find out who has the Loyal Vassal trait.
This is only possible when one is injured or sick, it does not remove other traits
Toggles cheat traits, such as Healthy Vassal.
Toggles cheat traits, such as Popular priest
Toggles additional target cheats (ATC), includes Priest and Strong/Genius buffs.
Toggles additional target cheats (ATC), includes stewardship and martial buffs.
Traits include Intrigue, Learning, and Marshal education.
Traits include Stewardship, and Diplomacy education.
Beacons a Doctor with god like abilities.
Moves them to your court, so long as they are unlanded
Sometimes you marry a bastard who would better suit you legitimized.
Adopt them, and make them part of your dynasty, this will also adopt their children, and any of their children.
[From.GetFirstName] will befriend [This.GetFirstName], making [This.GetHerHim] one of your best friends.
[This.GetFirstName] will become the spouse of [From.GetFirstName]. If [From.GetFirstName] is a §Yfemale§!, it will become a §Ymatrilineal§! marriage
[This.GetFirstName] will be an indebted servant of [From.GetFirstName] for ten years. During that time [This.GetFirstName] will have a hard time saying no to any requests from [From.GetFirstName].
Need them closer to you? Like in your dungeon closer? Hire the most effective thugs to abduct them and bring them directly to your dungeons.
You will seduce them with your wiles and new life will form
You will seduce them with your wiles and new life will form, none the wiser will be the onlookers.
Call forth the most effective assassins in all of the world. None can escape their grasp, and none shall know who pointed the way.
[From.GetFirstName] will usurp all of [This.GetFirstName]'s titles. [This.GetFirstName] will still have claims on said tiles.
[This.GetFirstName] will renounce all claims on titles in your direct demesne, but will retain [This.GetHerHis] claims on other titles not within your demesne.
Cleans the province baronies of negative modifiers like Looted or New Administration.
Enables Automatic Prosperity for all your provinces, only yours.
Disables Automatic Prosperity for all your provinces

Disables the automatic Disease Resistant buff
